website_summaries.verdict: The Vivoactive HR's versatile, multipurpose function and design make it one of the better smart GPS fitness watches on the market.
pros: There's a wealth of features here, including all-day activity tracking, phone notifications, built-in optical heart-rate sensor, GPS, multiple sport profiles and an always-on display
It can be worn in the shower and while swimming
cons: It's bulky, there are occasional connection and syncing problems, and the mobile app is confusing

customer_reviews.title: Great Features, Lousy Quality
customer_reviews.text: I've had my watch less than 9 months. I loved what it can do, but it randomly died on me - the display began to flicker and produce nothing but wavy lines, as noted in the photograph - and Garmin was of no help. Rather than fix the problem, they wanted $120 to consider fixing the problem. I expected more support at this price point. The lack of durability really shocked me.
customer_reviews.author: M. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Returned THREE TIMES due to LEAKS
customer_reviews.text: Returned and replaced THREE TIMES due to leaking issues. I only swim and shower. No diving, no scuba, no snorkeling. It's never been more than two feet underwater, and yet this swimmer's watch has failed THREE TIMES! Three different ones. Garmin has been great about returning and replacing them, I'll give them credit. And other Garmin equipment I have is wonderful. But WTF? This watch is made for swimming! It has swimming apps from the factory. How could ordinary swimming hurt it, over and over? One Garmin guy said maybe it was sweat, or maybe chlorine. HTF could sweat or chlorine affect a watch made for swimming? WORTHLESS!
customer_reviews.author: Viola DaGamba

customer_reviews.title: A good, reliable product from Garmin
customer_reviews.text: A good, reliable product from Garmin. Locks GPS in 2 sec when I go for run. I use it for my indoor swimming (I hated my Fit bit Surge as I could not even use it in rain). I can add more custom activities. I use it for my badminton games. Many options on apps and widgets. Lot of data to navigate through, I wish it was little bit more intuitive. After a week of playing with an apps it is not a problem at all. More data is always good.
customer_reviews.author: Runner05982

customer_reviews.title: Poor Battery and Terrible Display Brightness
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this device for my wife as a Christmas gift. For the first time in our 25 years of marriage she has asked me to return a gift. The watch display was so dim it was almost impossible to read. In addition she would wear the watch and within 24 hours the watch would be out of battery. A battery that doesn't last at least 24 hours makes the sleep tracking almost useless unless you charge the watch twice a day. I'm a big fan of Garmin watches, having owned many in the past and currently own a Fenix 5X myself. This Vivoactive HR watch however completely misses the mark.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Oliveri

customer_reviews.title: If only the customer service didn't stink...
customer_reviews.text: Firstly, this product is great. The reason for the one-star review is quite simple: Garmin's support absolutely sucks. The screen on my vivoactive HR cracked last week rendering the touchscreen inoperable. I filed a warranty claim with Garmin and they're of the disposition that this is cosmetic damage, not functional damage. Touch screen doesn't work mind you. They'd like $120 to send me a refurbished unit. I think 50-60% of the purchase price on the first warranty claim is a con. For what they're asking, I could damn near buy a whole new unit. So why have a warranty on something when you're going to charge your customers damn near the purchase price to replace it?
customer_reviews.author: D. Hill

customer_reviews.title: HR problems
customer_reviews.text: I have had watch for about 5 months, everything works great except HR function while training is always messing up more and more, you have to mess with watch every workout to get HR to work right, function will either stay to high or not change at start of workout. I don't know why watch works sometimes and not other times, glad I did not buy one of those 600 dollar models and have this problem. Maybe they will g ix this problem through an upgrade, I will post follow up if gets worse or better.
customer_reviews.author: J.  R. P.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: I've had this watch for about a year now and in my final verdict is "disappointing." After one year of daily wear, my watch face cracked up setting it gently on my bathroom counter. This crack has rendered half of the screen useless. It has never been great at measuring my heart rate accurately, but within the last couple months it's completely off by 20-30 beats. Things I do like: the gps function is nice and the activity logging works nice. The battery life cannot be beat for a smart watch. Annoying but not a deal breaker: calories burned is much too generous and will lead you to eat more than you probably should.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Amoret

customer_reviews.title: Great product that won't sync.
customer_reviews.text: The Garmin has great options for walking, running, biking etc. works better then the Fitbit HR that I bought that broke after a month and Fitbit doesn't warranty their product against moisture. Isn't sweat moisture? The problem with the Garmin is that the software sucks. Hard to setup and rarely syncs with my phone. If they ever fix the software issues I would give it 5 stars. Battery life is good. Accuracy rocks. Just bad software
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Won't charge
customer_reviews.text: I love the look and feel of this watch but since getting it I have only been able to charge it once by placing it down on the table every so meticulously. And that was from charging it right out of the box. I am now trying to charge it for the second time and can't get it to charge at all. I haven't dropped and haven't gotten it wet at all so I am no sure what the issue is and can't find an answer on the Garmin website. Anyone else have a similar issue? It's too bad because I really like the watch, but can't get it to charge.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Graves

customer_reviews.title: Not very durable, spend the extra money and get a better fit watch
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I both had these watches. My first screen cracked after only a couple of weeks normal use. No drops or major impacts. I found this odd considering this watch is supposed to be good for a variety of outdoor activities and I was only doing spin class. After arguing with support I received a warranty replacement (probably a refurb). That one lasted a little longer but then just stopped. Black screen, unresponsive. Before that, my wife's had stopped working. We've had 3 factory replacements and the wife finally opted to go with the fitbit instead. I'm still using the last remaining working Garmin (her warranty replacement) as my 2nd one died too. Very disappointing...
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Great watch until you go swimming
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoyed using this device, everything was great until I went for a swim. It is funny as I bought this, especially for swimming. The watch stopped working after 2 minutes of swimming and I couldn't recover it. Garmin was kind enough to send me a replacement, but still, it was very disappointing after spending so much for a watch. If the new watch will work well, I highly recommend this device...
customer_reviews.author: Tamir

customer_reviews.title: Great waterproof watch, until it isn’t (~3 years)
customer_reviews.text: I wore it 24/7, except for charging (which it needs very seldom and does quite quickly). Sleep, shower, bathe, swim, summer camps, no problem, until a little after my third year of having it. Water seems to have seeped in under the screen during a bath and killed it. I did have to buy a package of replacement band loops, because those would get caught on stuff and break about once a year or so. I got it to help monitor a suspected cardiac condition known as POTS. While in the cardiologist’s office I’d compare the readings they were getting with the watch and they were always spot on.
customer_reviews.author: AP7

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME FITNESS WATCH!!!!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE my garming vivoactive HR. I had the fitbit surge and was so frustrated with it, I couldn't get it wet any way and it would malfunction for over a week. The vivoactive is the same price and has so much more to offer!!! LOVE IT. The only downside is the community is small, so if you are in it for the social media aspect you will be disappointed. But for my taste this is 100% more effective and 300 times better than the fitbit surge. Garmin ROCKS!!!! I would definitely recommend this product over Fitbit.
customer_reviews.author: Shoe Addict

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Watch is great- app is great!
customer_reviews.text: This watch is amazing- it's comfortable, the battery last for about 5 days with Bluetooth, location services, and everything on, with activities on about 1-2 hours a day; short story, battery life is amazing. It is fully waterproof. I swim with it every day. I can't yet speak to the durability, but two weeks in, this watch is incredible and the interface on the watch, and especially on the phone app (iPhone 6s) is incredible- both from a usability and interface standpoint. The biggest surprise for me is the sleep tracking and how easy it is to track and useful and accurate it is. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey M Wellington

customer_reviews.title: Not Water Resistent
customer_reviews.text: Contrary to claim, this watch is not water resistant. Upon clarification, Garmin told me that few watch parts are not water resistant hence they will stop working when exposed to water. This is what happened with me. In this event, you will have to ship the product back to Garmin at your expense (via insured mail). After receiving the watch, they may repair or send you a watch which is supposed to be modified to work in water. Funny .. when swimming is a supported exercise mode. Stay away and buy a better watch.
customer_reviews.author: Nirmal

customer_reviews.title: Screen design flaws
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this watch. It worked great for the 1st five month. I hooked the watch up to charging & when I put the watch back on I noticed the screen was cracked. I am very careful with the watch & know I did nothing to cause the crack. As I did a google search on the cracked screen, I found out this is a common problem that Garmin does not take responsibility for. That is disappointing, and I will look to buy a watch from a company that treats their customers better.
customer_reviews.author: jay masters

customer_reviews.title: Not So Great in the Pool
customer_reviews.text: This was my first fitness watch and it got the best reviews of watches that could be worn whe swimming so I was excited to get it. However, in the 2 1/2 years I've had the watch, I have now had three replacements because of issues with the watch freezing, the display flickering, and sometimes just not working at all. And, like everything else you buy. after the first replacement, I was given refurbished watches as replacements. I wasn't told what the issues were before but this time I was told that there was a known issue with the waterproof casing, which apparently is not so waterproof. With the problems I had, I imagine they were also this same issue.
customer_reviews.author: E. Dodd

customer_reviews.title: Poor stair counter.
customer_reviews.text: In general I like the device, in fact I bought another after I accidentally destroyed my first one. It seams to keep good track of my steps. The thing I Don’t like about it is it sucks at tracking stairs. I can go up and down stairs all day and it might count 3 flights ( it won’t track individual stairs). I had managed to get to 9 flights and was about to reach target, I went up and down the same flight of stairs 4 times (13 stairs each time) and it registered none. It might seem like a silly point, but it’s one of the things that I like to track.
customer_reviews.author: Niall O'hagan

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Garmin watch
customer_reviews.text: Love this watch. It is far better than the Fitbit Surge I was using. Battery holds a charge even if you use the GPS. I wore mine for a week and when i put it on the charger it was still 40%. easy to read color screen, Sync's quickly and if you use the free 3rd party app it will transfer your data to your Fitbit account if you have one. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: frustrating
customer_reviews.text: I got this last year as a gift. It does everything it's supposed to, except that I can hardly ever get it to pair with my phone. I don't wear it all the time, only when I run or swim. I turn it off when it sits in the drawer. Still, this should not affect the bluetooth connection. I have so many other devices that pair when I turn them on. This shouldn't be hard. I have reread and followed directions countless times, and nothing works. I use it to tell me how far I have run, and my pace, and that's about all its good for.
customer_reviews.author: Bristol Bay

customer_reviews.title: Just stay away from Garmin "smart" products
customer_reviews.text: I should have learned from the troubles I had with my Garmin Index Scale and avoided Garmin... Basically the same issues on both devices is the wireless connectivity.... While I like everything else about the Watch, it refuses to stay connected with my phone... I look at the Connect app and the last sync was hours ago... so I have to manually reconnect them and resync... Also do not expect the battery to last 8 days like they claim... in 4 days from 100% charge I was at 28% and this was just in watch mode...
customer_reviews.author: Jim L. Bigelow

customer_reviews.title: Watch face became unglued
customer_reviews.text: I bought this watch in February of 2018. I never was rough with it. While it worked, I must admit I loved it. I owned an Apple and Sony smartwatch, along with a Fitbit watch and liked this one best, at least for what I needed it for...slow walks at night as I'm 62 on disability. But, 2 days ago, the watch face basically became literally "unglued." It came apart and it seems it's held together by glue. It shows nothing on the face now when I gently pushed the cover back in place. Very strange since I was casually walking in the house when it came apart. Any thoughts, anyone? Thanks and enjoy your week. Phil
customer_reviews.author: Philip

customer_reviews.title: Super device with excellent warranty  and great customer service
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a gift for my husband more than a year ago and he has used it every day since. He uses it to track steps in daily life and we enjoy the tracking feature when we hike. It takes a beating as we camp & travel and he swims laps. It initially had some issues tracking flights of stairs but he followed up with customer service and worked out most of the bugs. The band broke once and they sent him the replacement with no questions asked. It quit working due to a water seal failure and Garmin is repairing or replacing it for free(we haven't gotten it back yet to know which they are doing).
customer_reviews.author: digitalblonde2001

customer_reviews.title: excellent battery life.  Only downside is display is not bright
customer_reviews.text: I switched to the Vivoactive HR watch from a Galaxy Sport and a Galaxy Watch 46mm. Both Samsung watches had a day to 1.5 day battery life. The Vivoactive is giving me a weeks worth of battery life and still isn't completely drained. That is not using the GPS function of either watch. When using the GPS functions all three watches will drop faster but the Samsungs at a much faster rate than the Garmin. The screen on the Vivoactive is not as bright as I would like it at times but if that is what is making the battery life so much better I can live with it without complaint. This is definitely a 5 star watch to me
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best multi use fitness tracker for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product and still in almost perfect condition for 5+ months of daily use. I do not get this product wet in water while showering or swimming so I cannot commit on it being water proof. I run and/or walk every day it it tracks my steps and distance very accurately i feel compared to several of the FitBits I have had. It had all of the features and benefits I was looking for. If and when this one breaks or gets out dated I will definitely be buying another one. My favorite feature is that it vibrates every hour I am stationary and reminds me to get up and move.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Doleshal

customer_reviews.title: First update smartwatch with Garmin Express before trying to sync with iPhone
customer_reviews.text: I first had trouble pairing with my iphone. After uploading to my iphone the latest Garmin Connect app and many tries pairing. I was ready to return the smart watch. But then I thought of trying to update my vivoactive HR with the Garmin Express app that I use to manage my GPS's. That was the trick, after connecting my vivoactive HR watch to my computer, I updated the smartwatch. It rebooted after I disconnected it from the computer. Then I tried pairing and on first try got the pairing number to enter onto my iphone. I had an early fitbit. I'm eager to try this Garmin smartwatch for walking, and once spring arrives biking and rowing (i.e. leisure kayaking).
customer_reviews.author: J. W. Goetsch

customer_reviews.title: Very n ice with many functions that will work well to keep up with your active life.
customer_reviews.text: This is just what I needed to keep track of my exercise and other things. The apps are nice and the function of the software works well. It is a little big, but I figure it has to be in order to do so many things and still be able to see the results. I use the alarm and notifications and really enjoy these features. It has a function that you can use to set your walking and running pace so it can accurately keep count for you. I am very happy with this and so glad I was able to get it.
customer_reviews.author: tanna

customer_reviews.title: Good tracker.
customer_reviews.text: Thought it would be huge on my wrist but it is just right. Things I wish it had: 1. A screen more like my smartphone, bright and easy to see. 2. Glass screen for better wear resistance. 3. More comfortable band. Things I like: 1. Lightweight 2. Good readability in sunlight. 3. Bluetooth connection and being able to see text messages. 4. The ability to change faces. 5. Water resistance. So far this has been pretty good, it's not perfect in my eyes but I'd buy another if nothing else seemed better.
customer_reviews.author: SkierBrian

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy if you have an iPhone
customer_reviews.text: Save your money and don't buy this if you have an iphone. I had this for years and it worked great with my Android device. Switched to an iPhone and had problems ever since. I can't connect it to my bluetooth at all so I can't do updates now. I can't track my runs. All it is really is just another fitness tracker and it doesn't even work that great as far as that goes. I'm so disappointed with this thing. I wasted over 200 dollars when it first came out. Guess I'll just have to save up for an apple watch.
customer_reviews.author: gypsy_cookie

customer_reviews.title: NOT Waterproof as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Great features and functions but it is NOT waterproof. Supposed to be waterproof for swimming down to 50 meters. Replaced 2 times in first 2 months and now not eligible for return after 30 day window and cannot get my money back. Having to deal directly with the manufacturer and the replacement they sent failed due to NOT waterproof as well. Love the watch but cannot swim, do dishes, wash car or wash hands with it on without it completely crashing and requiring replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Eye

customer_reviews.title: Trouble with the Watch Band
customer_reviews.text: I had this for a couple of years . The watch itself was OK, but the band was definitely inferior. The rubber irritated my skin so I could not wear it at night. I replaced the band but had the same result. Then the plastic broke where the band attached to the watch. There was a minimum charge of $100 to get it fixed, so I bought an Apple watch instead. This watch is somewhat dated so I would not recommend it unless you are on a tight budget and you get a real bargain.
customer_reviews.author: Selim Gamer

customer_reviews.title: Plastic connector to band broke
customer_reviews.text: This was a fine watch for my husband, but after only 15 months, the plastic connector between the band and the watch broke on one side. Not possible to fix in any way that we can tell, so we will have to purchase another watch. Very disappointed -- considering what this watch is designed for, one would think that they could create a connection that won't fail and render the watch useless. My forerunner 35 has a much more stable attachment for the watch band (I've had that watch for longer than the vivoactive).
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does not last
customer_reviews.text: This watch has great features. However, after sporadic wearing, while stored mostly in a drawer, it has died. I put it away over the summer and just started wearing it again about 6 weeks ago. Yesterday, it quit working. This is exceedingly disappointing in an expensive watch. I CANNOT recommend a product that quits working after less than a year, especially since it has spent the better part of 6 months in a drawer.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love Hate
customer_reviews.text: So I love how the watch operates and functions - fantastic. And I hate how I have nearly zero control over my data. Getting data into MS Excel or even a CSV file is impossible even after a day of googling every possible work around. Garmin owns Delorme including TOPO NA and the GPX files are not compatible. So if you want to do some heavy lifting with your data it just is not possible with the Garmin wrist products. If i could only get a CSV from Garmin I could turn this into a Ten star review
customer_reviews.author: Randall

customer_reviews.title: Not water proof.
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I both had this watch. It worked well for 1.5 and 2 years. We've both swam with it it before. Recently we went swimming and both watches were ruined afterwards. The display was scrambled and after it was dry I noticed water oozing out the sides of the screen. Would be great if it lasted longer. We are hesitant to purchase another Garmin watch.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Kaufman

customer_reviews.title: It has more features and touch screen is nice...
customer_reviews.text: I just got it today - its okay, I like the touch screen. This is my 3rd garmin (all Forerunners which I loved) I got this one because I'm now swimming. It was not easy to set up. There are some cool features with this watch, but it was not very easy to sink up & to install the update. I'm not slow or new to technology so I can tell you this was harder than it needed to be. I'm also not in love with the wideness of the watch, I have bought a new colored (which I purchased the same time I bought the watch) band because I am NOT feeling the design of the watch.
customer_reviews.author: VEB

customer_reviews.title: Great watch!
customer_reviews.text: I love my watch, it is simple yet effective for what I need. Tracks just fine with gps and has plenty of options for activities and plenty of things to download from the garmin store. Get notifications on your watch through Bluetooth, answer the phone from your watch but cannot talk with your watch. Great product, I love mine and plenty of my friends that have it as well have nothing but good things to say about it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lasted only 5 months - Junk!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this watch just 5 months ago. Worked great for the first 4 months. Then, when I was seeking to download my information in Garmin Connect, something went wrong. The watch kept freezing up, the Connect said that there was no blue tooth connection, and the phone didn't register that blue tooth even existed. There was no icon on the face any more. Well after seeking to get it to reboot using the "set to default" button under system. Everything froze. Can't get it to turn on, even though fully charge. Not worth serving as a paper weight. The price is not worth the trouble. I decided to go with Samsung this next time. Don't buy this piece of junk!
customer_reviews.author: Joel DB

customer_reviews.title: Functionally great, but has terrible screen
customer_reviews.text: I had to change my rating and review now that I’ve had the watch for over a year and a half. Functionally, I couldn’t be happier with the watch. The problem is the screen it is far too susceptible to cracks and scratches. Going into the new year it looks like I’ll have to get a new watch. When I paid $200 For this one I expected it to last for a long time. Update: the screen on this watch is very weak and they want $120 to fix it. In retrospect I wouldn't pay over $50 for this watch.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Simon

customer_reviews.title: Absolute Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Giant piece of garbage. Pros: - integrates with Garmin Connect which has great analytics Cons: - GPS doesn’t sync half the time - Bluetooth almost never syncs, particularly if the battery dies - Screen is dim on brightest setting in the dark - Sluggish manuevering through the menus - Inconsistent activation of the back light - Watch band caused bacteria red marks on my wrist So basically, everything but the actual watch itself is great. Do yourself a favor and just avoid all Garmin sports watches. This is the second one I’ve purchased, with equivalent results.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding and can be found at a discount.
customer_reviews.text: Best cycling tracker currently available. Only issue is that it doesn't track power instruments, which is a shame. I also have an Edge 810, which does capture power. Vivoactive HR keeps track of virtually any other cycling, or for that matter, many other sports, very accurately. Connect IQ provides access to a large array of other excellent apps to track or present different watch faces. Should exceed your expectations!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great watch.
customer_reviews.text: This watch is fantastic. My son wanted an Apple watch but it was way out of our price range. I got this watch on sale and it does everything he needs. He really needed something waterproof so he could wear it during swim practice and this watch has done exactly what he needed. It is also nice because he can see and read a text during school and also see who is calling. The battery life is great. He has had no complaints. Great value and a great watch.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for me for about 1 year then it died in the pool at about 2 feet depth.
customer_reviews.text: So I just had the same experience for a second time. I had my first version of this watch fail during swim in the pool and I just wrote it off as something went wrong. I paid out another $200 for the same exact model of watch and then 14 months later the same result. How can a 10-meter watch that is built to be used in the pool last only a year when it has never been submerged deeper than 1 meter. Don't get this watch wet or you will be sorry. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simply Love my Vivoactive HR GPS
customer_reviews.text: I simply love my Garmin VivoActive HR + GPS smart watch. Battery life is amazing, It's super comfortable and isn't this huge monstrosity sitting on my wrist. I did have a MS Band 2 prior to my purchase of the Garmin VivoActive and the Garmin is a way better product. I would recommend the VivoActive to anyone looking for a good easy to use fitness tracker/smart watch without all the "unneeded" Apps that come with the Apple watch or the Samsung devices
customer_reviews.author: Daniel E. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this
customer_reviews.text: The photo posted on the Amazon web site is deceptive. The screen is a very dull gray color and is very difficult to see. Attempting to turn the brightness up doesn’t accomplish anything and even at 100% looks horrible. For 200 dollars you’d expect better quality. Unfortunately I had to return it because of the bad quality and had to pay $11.00 in return postage. All considered this was a bad experience.
customer_reviews.author: The Wolf is Hungry

customer_reviews.title: I wanted the garmin to monitor my heartbeat and after ...
customer_reviews.text: I wanted the garmin to monitor my heartbeat and after having a health problem, I find out that the garmin is not even close to being accurate and in fact is not effective in helping me moniter my daily/hourly heart performance. At the doctor's office we compared the garmin to their equipment and it was off by 50%. I could live with plus, minus 10% but not 50%. Very False Claims by the Sellers. I am disappointed that Amazon is supporting this poor product and now I find out it is too late to return.
customer_reviews.author: richard dies

customer_reviews.title: Garmin vivoactive HR (heart rate)
customer_reviews.text: I love this Garmin watch, a world of information. Plus get a bonus of cheaper health insurance once you dial it all in. The face is large enough for a man wrist, and maybe it IS a man watch. I wear on my ankle, sort of looks like I'm on house arrest ;) Doesn't bother me to wear it to bed, as it tracks your light sleep and deep sleep. I put the golf app on, an it is very cool. Love it, you will 2.
customer_reviews.author: O.B.#1

customer_reviews.title: The Garmin Vívoactive HR GPS Smart Watch or the Garmin Edge 200
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two, one for myself and one for my wife. I have another Garmin GPS product for cycling, after the first ride I noticed that the devices do not match for distance. It's only off about .10 after 13ish miles. Neither uses a bike mounted sensor. I was also hoping that when I imported both into Garmin Connect that it would see the ride time/date/location and not make it 2 different activities. Which device do I trust? The Garmin Vívoactive HR GPS Smart Watch or the Garmin Edge 200. My issues are not with the seller/amazon but with Garmin. I still like both products, Garmin just could do some tweaking.
customer_reviews.author: Earl S. Rider Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Broke just out of warranty period.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in June 2016. Go figure, just a few months after the one year warranty is out, so is the screen. I now have a $250 watch that no longer works. Just as a heads up, it gives no warning. I got an alert, looked at the watch, and the screen was making some really nifty looking rainbow stripes.... then... Viola! Dead. The screen will flicker to life every now and then, but it saves no data/steps. I used to love this watch/tracker. It does everything I want. Integrates easily with Map My Run and Strava. I love that it has its own GPS. I just wish it still worked. Now, I am in the market for another.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Goodgame

customer_reviews.title: A disappointment
customer_reviews.text: When it works, it is great: but it often fails to deliver: * needs to be reset (locks-up until battery dies or can be hard reset); * fails to get a pulse, * the time can change randomly (so avoid using it for quick glance of the time). Customer support however, is good... when I complained twice they did get back to me with suggestions (e.g., reset it). The GPS work fine (making allowances for city building messing with data).
customer_reviews.author: parzival

customer_reviews.title: great fitness watch
customer_reviews.text: Great fitness watch, wish it looked better though. Otherwise, the apps are great and pretty accurate, except for cloudy and rainy days, where I'm pretty sure it throws off the GPS. Its cool you can post activities on line to share with others, the heart rate and sleep tracker are great, encouraging me to push myself but also get a great night's sleep. Waterproof means you won't have to worry about where you wear it.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Chang

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last long
customer_reviews.text: I bought it at the end of November 2017 and then it died at the beginning of April 2018. I loved everything about it up until then. Their warranty is useless and to repair it would be $99 and a hassle when I can buy something new for about that price. I probably won't be buying at least this model again. I was not hard on it and it died just in the middle of the day when I wasn't even doing anything that could damage it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: it is excellent for what I use it for (steps
customer_reviews.text: Although I do not use all of the functions available with this unit, it is excellent for what I use it for (steps, sleep and golf). It seems to be more accurate than my previously used Fitbit which I had to replace when the activate button broke. Battery life is incredible especially compared to Fitbit (about 13 days). Somewhat slow to sync when you don''t do it daily. I've had it about 6 weeks and am very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Wichita Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Last A Year.
customer_reviews.text: Glad I waited to write my review. In four days I will have had this for one year. It has died seven (7) days before I've owed it a year. It will not turn on, will not charge. VERY disappointed, to say the least. I have not dropped it, or bumped it. There's no reason for it to have stopped working. And as an aside, the little strap that holds the excess band in place, broke off about two weeks ago.
customer_reviews.author: Ramona

customer_reviews.title: Dependable, robust, accurate, easy to use, lasts forever
customer_reviews.text: Guys, this is a 2 year review of this watch: this watch is fantastic! I am tough on things and beat the heck out of them and this watch has never been damaged. Stays charged for a week plus, captures all of my workouts including biking and swimming, has altitude, shows text messages and calendar entries. I don’t know what I would do if I lost it. I’ll tell you what I would do, I would immediately buy another one, thanks Garman!
customer_reviews.author: kevin richardson

customer_reviews.title: excellent companion for anyone serious about health and fitness.
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant. Still discovering all the apps, widgets etc available. I've become something of a slave to the thing but it keeps me moving, which is the main thing. Definitely a good buy. Not too impressed with the associated the calorie app (I don't think it's a garmin product). I installed it only to find it doesn't have even a basic database of foods to start you off so you have to enter everything you eat along with all the health tracking data such as calories, sugar etc. Quickly gave up on that.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: I contacted Garmin and was told this was packaged in July of 2016 and is in a known bad batch. Pretty angry with you right now Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Do NOT buy from Amazon. The unit I received was DOA. Won't charge. Won't connect to the computer. I contacted Garmin and was told this was packaged in July of 2016 and is in a known bad batch. Pretty angry with you right now Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: C. Bemis

customer_reviews.title: Excellent choice for a smart watch
customer_reviews.text: Very good product. It's been as useful for business needs (meeting reminders, incoming text messages) as for activities. I track my walks using one of the available hiker apps and it makes it so much easier than using the one I've been using on my phone. The only reason for four stars instead of five is the web site is kind of clunky and the Windows desktop app has bugs such as maps not working correctly.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: Good for swimming
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my mother in law, she loves to swim and does it almost everyday. She keeps track of it as she has a heart conditions so this watch has helped her a lot to control her heart rate and the number of laps and effort that she puts on each swimming session. She is very happy with the watch and the app works great too, Garmin has not dissapointed us so far.
customer_reviews.author: YC

customer_reviews.title: Technology at its best!
customer_reviews.text: this item is really a step up from my previous Garmin equipment forerunner 302. But the best part is it will interface with my chest band style heart monitor i got with the forerunner. I have had it on while both water skiing and swimming with no issues. So bottom line, i have several Garmin products some as old as 15 years and while they are outdated they still work! so far the HR is well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: ken

customer_reviews.title: $&@*# Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This watch is $&@*# awesome! It tracks my sleep, steps, details of workouts using GPS, calories burned etc. Unlike the Fitbit, it is waterproof, so I can keep it on while swimming, kayaking, stand-up paddleboarding, or showering! The heart rate monitoring seems pretty accurate, even during higher heart rate activities. It will even time a workout while at the same time allowing me to use the stopwatch to time intervals.
customer_reviews.author: Paul K. Smith

customer_reviews.title: they are great at marketing but are not able to put a ...
customer_reviews.text: I have not even had it 1 day and am already experiencing issues. The watch WILL NOT SYNC and from looking at the forums this problem is experienced by many others. I will be returning this product, its just not worth the money for the features when the product intermittently works. This is the third Garmin watch I have had and swore with all the problems I had with my last one I would never buy from Garmin again, they are great at marketing but are not able to put a product out that consistently works!
customer_reviews.author: WW

customer_reviews.title: Great watch
customer_reviews.text: I've had this watch for a couple days now and I love it. All the negative reviews on here about the screen being to dim I don't think that holds any weight, I can see the display just fine, outside, inside, sunny, cloudy whatever the climate. The garmin connect app is super easy to use, the watch comes with so many features that I use daily it's great. The golf app is fantastic to super easy to download courses and brings them up within seconds. Overall I am very pleased with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality product but needs a few tweaks
customer_reviews.text: Quality Smart watch. Does most activities for exercise. Hope they add elliptical some day then it would be complete. The app for the smart phone completes the package as it adds many useful features including maps of your runs. The HR is not always accurate as it sometimes gives particularly low readings for a few minutes then jumps up to where it should be so the HR readings cannot be taken for gospel. Superior to the current fitbit products for runners.
customer_reviews.author: J. Schofield

customer_reviews.title: Garmin/Extended Warranty does not back their device
customer_reviews.text: We purchased a Garmin Vivoactive HR 7/31/19. The device began having issues after only a couple of months. It was losing data and shutting down until it stopped working altogether. Apparently these devices are no longer made so Garmin will only send us refurbished devices, which they have sent two. Both devices have not worked at all. We've asked that Garmin just refund us our money so we can purchase something else or replace the device with a comparable device. It has been over a month now and we are still without a working device or a refund. Clearly the extended warranty on this device is useless and a waste of money. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy3239

customer_reviews.title: Very Impressed!
customer_reviews.text: This little guy has really helped me with my workouts. I never would have spent the money on something like this in the past but a long time friend and a dietician told me I should get it and all the reasons why and now I'm very glad I did. It motivates me to move more during the day and being able to see my workouts and sleep patterns is great! Battery lasts almost two weeks for me, charging time is about an hour. Thus watch is totally worth it. I have always bought gamin products in the past and I'm glad I purchased this as well. Great little watch I don't regret buying it.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Holds a charge from 6 to 7 days
customer_reviews.text: I have not had any problems with it. It holds a charge from 6 to 7 days. The heart rate monitor is not too accurate when working out with weights. I use the older version Garmin chest strap because it is very accurate. I use it with the downloadable "HR always" app since the watch always defaults to using the built-in HR monitor. When the app is used, the built-in HR monitor must be turned off to get the HR reading from the chest strap.
customer_reviews.author: Big D

customer_reviews.title: How The Watch Works
customer_reviews.text: I got this watch to measure distance, calorie count, type of exertion for water aerobic classes, and it seems to work well in those areas. The battery if the watch is worn continuously lasts about 5 days. I have difficulty getting my Mac to recognize the watch when it has been connected to the USB charge cord. However, my biggest problem with this watch is something in the strap material causes a rash on my wrist if I continue to wear it after swimming even after I have cleaned & dried the strap!!!
customer_reviews.author: Brown of Fla.

customer_reviews.title: 8 months of moderate use and death
customer_reviews.text: After less than 8 months of using this product, I turned the watch off one night using the specified power of buttons and the screen turned off. Moments later the sensors on the bottom turned on and stayed on and the watch would not come back on. Now when you press the power button the Garmin logo appears and then the watch goes bad. It seems that this happens for others (with no fix) & on the fit bit charge 2 Hr. I guess it doesn’t matter at this point.
customer_reviews.author: brandolone

customer_reviews.title: Best multisport watch
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for smartwatch functions, this is NOT the watch. Yes, it has notifications, but they are basic (I'm okay with that). The VAHR is for people who do a bunch of sports, with dedicated "apps" and the possibility to add or create generic ones (only 2, there should be more). Its waterproofness is great, and it doesn't bother at night (misses recording naps). I really love the VAHR, but i expected a little bit more in GPS performance (sometimes routes are not perfect) and it isnt' the most stylish watch to use in certain occasions, but besides that is the perfect watch for people who practise a lot of sports.
customer_reviews.author: Guido T.

customer_reviews.title: Replaced within a year and replacement broke after another 8 moths.
customer_reviews.text: I initially really liked this watch as it did everything i wanted it to and more. However, when i really needed it during my trip to Yosemite park, the HR detector cracked and destroyed the watch. I was really bummed out to miss out on recording my paths in Yosemite but after contacting garmin, they sent me a new watch and everything was fine. Well, that lasted about 8 months because, as of a week ago my watch's HR tracking is all over the place. My suggestion is that you look for a more durable brand as i have lost all faith in this brand, especially after 2 repeat failures.
customer_reviews.author: S.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice product and elegant design
customer_reviews.text: My wife is a runner, she asked for this. So I bought it. She's happy, does everything she expects like uploading her run with whatever website so she could analyze it etc. Who knows, runners... But in any case, this is supposedly an upgrade from the Timex Ironman I got her not too long ago, which also does a lot of things that she expects. Between me and you, I think she just wants a change in style. She wears it all day, it's her smartwatch/fitness tracker. But I got to admit it's a very slick design. Happy wife, happy life!
customer_reviews.author: Son

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the price but lasted only 20 months
customer_reviews.text: It has all functionality most of the users would need. The Garmin app is great and I liked it much more than the one from Fitbit. The quality of materials is not the best but if you want to buy something that looks great and has the same functionality, you should prepare to pay more. There are only two complains I have: 1) I had to constantly sync it with my iPhone once a day or once in two days 2) it lasted only for 20 months after I swam in the pool (I bought it in 2016 without additional protection)
customer_reviews.author: Anastasia

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed in the watch
customer_reviews.text: I principally bought the watch to keep track of my heart rate while I exercise. It does not accurately keep track with or without using a heart rate monitor band. I can be exercising very strenuously and the monitor shows 74. I can stop exercising and it goes to 120! Very disappointed in the watch.
customer_reviews.author: Keith J. Anzel

customer_reviews.title: This watch is fantastic. It has every function I need as a ...
customer_reviews.text: This watch is fantastic. It has every function I need as a runner and then some, plus it is easy to navigate. The only draw back so far is the display is rather dim. I don't find it as a deterrent though to not buy the watch. I do need to spend some more time to see how to customize a few things. Overall though, its a sleek watch with all the modern touches I need for tracking a workout, tracking my daily activity and HR, plus keeping connected to the world with notifications from my phone.
customer_reviews.author: sew6508

customer_reviews.title: Great GPS Watch For The Money
customer_reviews.text: I have had the Garmin Vivoactive HR for about a month now. So far I love it. I've ran with it about 8 times now and wear it daily to track steps, sleep, and heart rate. Pros Accurate gps GPS signal in under 5 seconds. Easy to select and start activity Battery lasts 5 to 6 days between charges. Various watch faces and customization Several apps and widgets to choose from Heart rate monitor seems pretty accurate Lots of info under garmin connect app Some smart watch features Cons Watch face is not very bright in certain lighting Watch size is a little bulky
customer_reviews.author: rcarr

customer_reviews.title: Nice, Clean, Easy to use.  Repeated water issues.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice and easy to use. Like much better than prior models. The size and shape are much nicer and look a bit better if wearing with a suit. Like that it has all sports including golf and swimming. The sleep tracker has come in helpful - although I did not initially care for this feature. I would recommend. Update 2019: have purchased 3 of these. 2 had to be replaced, one twice, so looking for a different product. Love them but they all had the same issue - water. Initial dunk into pool or ocean killed them. Great customer service at Garmin but, looking for a different option that will work when doing water activities.
customer_reviews.author: CS

customer_reviews.title: I love the way this syncs my data
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased 3 of these types of watches in the past. Some have been recalled (Basis), etc... I love the way this syncs my data. I also enjoy the way it feels on my wrist. I had stopped wearing watches for years because they simply didn't feel good. Best fitness watch I have owned. Easy to use. Easy to sync with I phone and computer. Easy to charge. Comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: and I love it. It sits a lot higher off the ...
customer_reviews.text: This was an upgrade from the regular vivoactive, and I love it. It sits a lot higher off the wrist than the regular vivoactive which has been an adjustment, but overall it's much more comfortable because it's thinner. I can bend my wrist back while wearing this which is awesome. (If I was doing something like a plank with the regular one, I would either have to take it off or flip it.) Accuracy seems to be there with GPS tracking outside, and my heart rate readings have been pretty close. I'm really happy that I decided to upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon F.

customer_reviews.title: This was a great watch and I really liked it with one exception
customer_reviews.text: This was a great watch and I really liked it with one exception. Since I am over 40 in my eyesight is starting to fail, the screen was very hard to read because it is very dim. The text messaging and email capabilities of this watch were rendered useless because the text is so small I could not see it. I ended up getting an Apple watch which I can see fine because the screen is brighter and more vivid than this watch. Although, this watch was better in terms of battery life, size and functionality it just didn't work because of how dim the screen was.
customer_reviews.author: Felice Navidad

customer_reviews.title: WOW!!
customer_reviews.text: You'll see in my other reviews - I'm technically challenged. And this lil device is a dream! Doesn't matter whether I'm riding, jogging, hiking or in the gym. I get all my readings and the best - is the absolute simplistic ease of use. SO happy with this purchase! And the battery lasts me a few days!
customer_reviews.author: Madi M

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Watch! Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: Only reason I gave it a 4 start instead of a 5 is because the strap broke in my sleep. See photo. Most unexpected. I am a bit sad. I initiated the insurance claim for repair. But to be fair.... except for a few operational resets during swimming and occasional inability to track GPS accurately when cycling... I think the watch worked as expected 99% of the time 24x7x365 for past 2 years. I find this Garmin model a very high price to benefit ratio compared to my wife's $500 apple watch. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: vmarata

customer_reviews.title: Sporadic blue tooth with short battery life!!! $120 to "repair" RIPOFF!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the Vivoactive HR GPS in February 2018. I researched read reviews and decided this would be the best product. It was for 6 months! At the beginning of August 2018 the battery would not stay charged for more than two days. The bluetooth quit working in July 2018 and yes, I have reset, reinstalled rebooted and tried every re-option out there. It will not connect! I then like many others contacted Garmin. $120 to repair the smartwatch...which I assume would be to send me a "refurbished replacement". No thanks! For the short time that it worked it was great....Now it is simply a band aide until either the Apple Watch Series 4 or new Fitbit is released!
customer_reviews.author: Uniquequa

customer_reviews.title: Great Battery Life
customer_reviews.text: After having several Fitbits I decided to try Garmin to see if it lasted longer and was better overall. I have not been happy with the quality and have had to reset the watch to connect to my phone. However, the battery life is longer than advertised and lasts about 8-9 days. The mapping feature and app are nice too.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Forton

customer_reviews.title: The watch is working great. I've been able to set notifications so it's ...
customer_reviews.text: The watch is working great. I've been able to set notifications so it's not buzzing me all the time, that was very easy to do. The Heart Rate monitor seems to be pretty close. I have a pacemaker and it's set at 60bpm. I know for a fact after several Doctor visits to verify that my heart rate will not go below 60, ever. I will notice the watch will on rare occasions display 58 or 59. While not right on it is good enough for me to see if anything is going haywire. I'm more concerned with high heart rates when I'm exercising and this does great.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald D Doyle

customer_reviews.title: Beat Yesterday!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had a couple Garmins now and this is by far my favorite. I did extensive research of the other brands because I need a device that fits my needs no matter who makes it. But I came back to Garmin for one main reason - waterproof. I was not taking a device off in the shower or risk taking a dip and forgetting I have it on. Now there’s other waterproof devices but my 2nd most important feature was price and this was very reasonable. I love all the other bells and whistles - customizable faces, bands, the app, and everything else. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Watch is working great. I'm not going to go into details about ...
customer_reviews.text: Watch is working great. I'm not going to go into details about watch but will tell you my personal feedback. The best part is that its water proof - I don't have to take it off for shower or swimming. Another thing I like about this watch is that battery holds enough charge for more than a week. Charging takes about 15 minutes. There are a good number of custom faces to chose from. I think the only issue I found is that there is no backup. My watch crashed one time and I lost all my settings that has to be reconfigured all over again.
customer_reviews.author: SD

customer_reviews.title: Questionable build quality
customer_reviews.text: Pros: long battery life, charges quickly, the Garmin mobile app is handy. Simple interface that is fairly straight forward to use. Connecting the watch with the Garmin sensors on my bike was easy. Cons: The touch screen came off (so I could see the internals) after about 12 months of light use. Rebooting the watch often gave me issues, as it would freeze and not want to come back online. This happened intermittently, but happened more & more until it finally just stopped turning on (despite being fully charged) after about 14 months. I downloaded a few a few apps (Philips Hue & Yoga), but neither ever worked. I wouldn't buy this again, as it deteriorated quickly.
customer_reviews.author: RR

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy - Touchscreen issues
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this product. I bought one and touchscreen stopped working after a few months out of warranty. If over $200 for an activity monitor, I would expect for this to last longer. I have been careful with this device when doing activities and there is not a scratch on it. But after shutting it down for the night and turning it back on the following morning, the touch screen stopped working. Explaining this to their customer service, they were apathetic to this obvious device flaw, and would not honor the warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy

customer_reviews.title: Lost 12 pounds in 3 weeks after buying this watch
customer_reviews.text: I am completely satisfied with my Garmin vivoactive HR. It provides a wealth of health data and provides the motivation to get healthier! I love the random popup notifications to get up and MOVE. I have used it for walking, cycling, and swimming. Mine has performed perfectly in the water with no sign of liquid infiltrating the electronics. I have lost 12 pounds in the past three weeks, attributable entirely to this watch. I'd type more, but my watch just told me to get off my butt and MOVE!
customer_reviews.author: Lee A. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: 2 thumbs up from previous model
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was wanting. Things i noticed were: The rectangular shape fit me better than it did my wife so she is sticking to the previous model. Band is wider than previous model. Love the physical button location as I used to hit the buttons on previous model If you want the best review of this product checkout DC rainmaker vivoactive hr review. By far my go to when researching stuff like this The only thing they could have had was add music storage as I like to run without being leashed to my phone.
customer_reviews.author: casey

customer_reviews.title: This gadget is awesome. When my fitbit died and their customer service ...
customer_reviews.text: This gadget is awesome. When my fitbit died and their customer service wouldn't do anything to keep me, I went shopping. This is it, stop looking. I love that it has a GPS, I'm able to run, bike, GOLF, and swim all with one gadget. No more having to remove when I jump in pool. Distance to the pin has really helped my golf game. Only ding is that when viewing indoors it can be a little dim. I am used to it now so not a factor but just something they could have done better. Even with that said, I am happy I moved off of FItBit and over to GARMIN. Much better product.
customer_reviews.author: BadApple

customer_reviews.title: Bought for my wife for Christmas, 2017. Last ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my wife for Christmas, 2017. Last week, it just quit. The return process looks cumbersome, especially since we live in Central America. My wife loves it so much that she is in crises mode right now because it stopped working. Tried troubleshooting based on the Garmin video online, but no luck. I will begin the process of replacing it tomorrow...if anyone from Garmin sees this and can help us with the cost of shipping/returning from a foreign country, and/or can streamline the seemingly arduous process of doing so, it would be appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The perfect watch for me after a lot of searching
customer_reviews.text: Update: I ended up calling Garmin customer service and they were AMAZING! I got a major discount on a refurbished watch when I sent my no-longer-working one in. Major credit to Garmin! -- I really love this watch. I spent a long time researching different activity tracking watching and this one ended up being perfect. But the touch screen stopped working after 9 months. Since I bought it from an independent seller, I don't think there are warranty options, which is really disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Great watch for the athlete!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical but now having lived with the watch for several weeks, I love it. I'm a cyclist and use a Garmin 1000 to track my cycling metrics but for keeping track of my running, elliptical, spin, daily steps, stairs and heart rate, this watch is great. I wear a heart strap while cycling and found that this watch is very accurate when compared to the Garmin 1000 (and my doctor's office's monitor). The added bonus is that the watch is sized just right and looks great. The watch also tells me of phone calls and texts. A bargain compared to Apple watches.
customer_reviews.author: rideabout

customer_reviews.title: Great fitness watch
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this watch a year now and I haven’t had any problems. I bought a screen protector and a silicone case for the watch face housing. The silicone case covers the buttons so I think that has helped elimate the problems other people have had with water damage. I wore this watch for the 8 hour Toughest Mudder with GPS on the whole time and I still had 30% battery left at the end. I bought this watch strictly for tracking my running and cycling. Receiving texts on the watch is a plus. My only complaint is that water can cause the touch screen to cycle to different display modes (watch face, heart rate, notifications, etc)
customer_reviews.author: Fitz

customer_reviews.title: Better than the Surge by miles.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a convert from Fitbit so this took a little while to get used to. There's so many ways you can customize what you see! The GPS is way better than the Fitbit, and so is the battery. I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Robert F. O'Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Great watch
customer_reviews.text: I love this smart watch, you can track so many things with it. It is almost scary, lol! Great for swimming, I was in the pool for over an hour with it on and had no problem. I have had it for over a week and I don't think I tapped into everything I can do with it yet. The only thing that I don't like is it does not automatically sync when you are close to your computer. You have to actually plug it in for it to sync. I do not have it synced to my mobile. I use to have a fitbit until it fell apart. This watch has so many more options and apps!
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth connectivity is very, very problematical and erratic
customer_reviews.text: Does a good job BUT - its always loosing the Bluetooth connection with my phone even when its right next to it. Also, re-connection can take, literally, hours and most times I have to delete the device from the app and start over again. A real pain in the *** and a great shame - not what I expected from Garmin!
customer_reviews.author: philip barnea

customer_reviews.title: Smart Watch.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic Smart Watch. Highly recommended. Steps, heart rate, sleeping pattern, stair flight's, all kinds of exercise monitoring, challenges, date, time. Calorie counter. It really does help me stay in good condition. Also, many front faces are arivable. I got the xl size. After two months, the blue tooth will not stay connected. Therefore no accurate sleep pattern and no accurate exercise review. I would not purchase another.
customer_reviews.author: King Richard

product_meta.title: Garmin vívoactive HR GPS Smart Watch, Regular fit - Black
product_meta.description: Size:Regular| Style:Watch OnlyRun, bike, swim, golf, ski and more with vivo active HR, the GPS smartwatch with Elevate wrist heart rate technology. Outside of your more active moments, its built-in activity tracker counts steps throughout the day and measures calories burned. The sunlight-readable, high-resolution touchscreen features smart notifications such as call, text, email, social media alerts and more. Customize your watch with more than 1,300 apps, watch face designs, data fields and widgets from our Connect IQ store. Battery charge lasts through all your activities with up to 8 days in watch/activity tracking mode (no GPS) or up to 13 hours using GPS.
feature_bullets: Regular fits wrist circumferences 5.39" to 7.68" (137 to 195 mm),GPS smartwatch with a sunlight-readable, high-resolution color touchscreen. Display size-28.6 mm x 20.7 mm.Display resolution:205 x 148 pixels
24/7 HEART RATE MONITORING - Elevate wrist heart technology gives you heart rate all day and night without an additional strap,Heart rate is not available while swimming
LONG BATTERY LIFE - Up to 8 days in watch/activity tracking mode. Battery life : GPS mode: Up to 13 hours. Smartwatch mode: Up to 8 days

SMART NOTIFICATIONS - Set any notification from your mobile device to display when paired with a compatible smartphone.Water rating:5 ATM, Compatible with Android 4.4 OS or Later,Bluetooth 4.0 or Later and AppleiOS 10.0 or Later,iPhone, iPad, iPod touch

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.8 out of 5 stars5,080 ratings3.8 out of 5 stars
